thread.title: ‘We can’t ask our neighbours to pay’ Hollande LASHES OUT at Trump over Mexico wall plans
thread.title_full: ‘We can’t ask our neighbours to pay’ Hollande LASHES OUT at Trump over Mexico wall plans

title: ‘We can’t ask our neighbours to pay’ Hollande LASHES OUT at Trump over Mexico wall plans
text:
1 of 9 December 1st, 2016: Francois Hollande decides not to run again in the next France presidency. 
But while the Spanish leader remained quiet on the subject of the US, Mr Hollande was eager to critics the controversial policies when asked about the problem of those who are trying to jump over the Ceuta fence. 
He told reporters: "Controls exist thanks to the EU. 
“What would the situation be if Europe weren’t there to define what we have to do to protect our external borders and to have a cooperation policy with third countries like Morocco or Turkey?” What kind of Europe would we be if we asked African countries to pay for that? Francois Hollande, French President 
He also insisted Europe has a “duty of asylum” to care for refugees, before adding: "Without the EU, what would we do? 
“Build walls as other countries do in another continent? And would we ask neighbours to pay for the wall? 
“What kind of Europe would we be if we asked African countries to pay for that?" REUTERS Francois Hollande praised the EU immigration plan as more ethicial 
The French president added Trump was not a “role model” Europe wants to follow because it is not good "neither from the ethical nor the political point of view". 
Mr Hollande’s comments are just the latest in a long line of criticism he has put at Mr Trump’s door since his election last November. 
Earlier this month, the US President’s attempt to impose a travel ban on citizens from seven Muslim-majority countries was described as “unacceptable” by the french leader - who warned there would be no future for Europe’s relations with the US “if this future isn’t defined in common”.
